summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a remote video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell on July 14, 2020. It outlines COVID-19 protocols for courthouse entry and addresses logistical details for the remote proceeding, including victim notification rights and Speedy Trial Act exclusions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for whom an arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order scheduling the proceedings and setting the protocols for the remote hearing and courthouse entry.

events.title: Remote Arraignment, Conference, and Bail Hearing
events.description: A remote video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: The court scheduled a remote video/teleconference for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing on July 14, 2020, due to COVID-19.
The order mandates strict COVID-19 protocols for courthouse entry, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and face coverings.
The court excluded time under the Speedy Trial Act from the defendant's arrest through July 14, 2020, citing logistical issues with remote proceedings and the need to discuss a protective order.
The government is instructed to inform the court if any alleged victim wishes to be heard on the question of detention pending trial, in accordance with victim rights statutes.
